h1.a: Ravens' 'Smoke' show: Joe Flacco, John Brown burning up camp

div.p: John Brown, who signed a one-year deal with the Ravens, looks like the deep-ball threat who could revive Joe Flacco and Baltimore's offense.

Ravens play of the day: Joe Flacco made an unreal throw to Chris Moore that traveled about 70 yards in the air. Rolling to his right at his own 28yard line, Flacco threw to left side of the field, where he connected with Moore inside the 5-yard line. There are not too many quarterbacks who have that level of arm strength.

ul.data-name: Ravens play of the day: Joe Flacco made an unreal throw to Chris Moore that traveled about 70 yards in the air. Rolling to his right at his own 28yard line, Flacco threw to left side of the field, where he connected with Moore inside the 5-yard line. There are not too many quarterbacks who have that level of arm strength.

div.p: Will Deshaun Watson keep up his incredible touchdown pace? How many starts will Tyrod Taylor make? NFL Nation has the details.

h1.a: Biggest injuries of NFL preseason: Star receivers on the mend

div.p: Here are the most crushing injuries of training camp and preseason so far, the prognosis for all those players and who could replace them.
John Harbaugh now knows he has to buy more than 50 pizzas to feed all of his players

div.p: Ravens kicker Justin Tucker and his son get a post-practice treat. The team brought in two ice cream trucks for one of the final days of training camp.

ul.data-name: Ravens kicker Justin Tucker and his son get a post-practice treat. The team brought in two ice cream trucks for one of the final days of training camp.

div.p: Ravens quote of the day: Ravens coach John Harbaugh on tight end Darren Waller, who practiced for first time Saturday after a year-long suspension: I love him, but like I told him, I'm going to be the hardest guy on him of anybody. I'm going to be on him every single day, because he has a lot to prove.

ul.data-name: Ravens quote of the day: Ravens coach John Harbaugh on tight end Darren Waller, who practiced for first time Saturday after a year-long suspension: I love him, but like I told him, Im going to be the hardest guy on him of anybody. Im going to be on him every single day, because he has a lot to prove.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

div.p: Ravens play of the day: John Brown continues to be the best wide receiver in training camp. He made three highlight-reel catches on Saturday. His best was diving to pull in a 30-yard pass from Joe Flacco along the right sideline.

ul.data-name: Ravens play of the day: John Brown continues to be the best wide receiver in training camp. He made three highlight-reel catches on Saturday. His best was diving to pull in a 30-yard pass from Joe Flacco along the right sideline.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

h1.a: John Harbaugh taps into 'The Office' to avoid injury jinx

div.p: Through two preseason games and 15 training camp practices, the Ravens have yet to suffer a major injury. Consider John Harbaugh "stitious."

h1.a: Ravens QB Jackson dazzles with juke-filled TD

div.p: Ravens rookie quarterback Lamar Jackson, in his second preseason appearance, delivered a highlight-reel, 9-yard touchdown run in a 33-7 win over the Rams.

John Harbaugh tapped into "The Office" when asked about the lack of injuries this summer for the Ravens: "We should just leave that alone not that we're superstitious. What's the old saying [from] Michael Scott? I'm not superstitious. But I am a little stitious."

ul.data-name: John Harbaugh tapped into "The Office" when asked about the lack of injuries this summer for the Ravens: "We should just leave that alone not that were superstitious. Whats the old saying [from] Michael Scott? Im not superstitious. But I am a little stitious."

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

h1.a: Flacco, Jackson lead TD drives as Ravens beat Rams 33-7

div.p: Joe Flacco threw a touchdown pass on his only series of the game, rookie quarterback Lamar Jackson ran for a score and the Baltimore Ravens rolled to a 33-7 preseason victory over the Los Angeles Rams on Thursday night.

Ravens first-round pick Lamar Jackson looked more comfortable than his NFL debut a week ago, leading Baltimore to scores on half of his eight drives against the Rams on Thursday night (three field goals and one touchdown). His best play was a highlight-reel, nine-yard run in which he faked out two Rams defenders to reach the end zone. Jackson still needs to be more consistent with his throws. He completed 7 of 18 passes (39 percent) for 119 yards. But Jackson and the Ravens have to be pleased with how Jackson limited his mistakes. This was a solid step forward for Jackson, who is looking to beat out Robert Griffin III to become Joe Flacco's primary backup for the start of the regular season.

ul.data-name: Ravens first-round pick Lamar Jackson looked more comfortable than his NFL debut a week ago, leading Baltimore to scores on half of his eight drives against the Rams on Thursday night (three field goals and one touchdown). His best play was a highlight-reel, nine-yard run in which he faked out two Rams defenders to reach the end zone. Jackson still needs to be more consistent with his throws. He completed 7 of 18 passes (39 percent) for 119 yards. But Jackson and the Ravens have to be pleased with how Jackson limited his mistakes. This was a solid step forward for Jackson, who is looking to beat out Robert Griffin III to become Joe Flaccos primary backup for the start of the regular season.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

div.p: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson looks more comfortable tonight than his first preseason game. Perhaps the biggest reason why: Jackson played behind a third-team offensive line last week and he's working behind the starting offensive line tonight. Jackson is getting much more time in the pocket in leading Baltimore to a touchdown and a field goal on his first two series.

ul.data-name: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson looks more comfortable tonight than his first preseason game. Perhaps the biggest reason why: Jackson played behind a third-team offensive line last week and he's working behind the starting offensive line tonight. Jackson is getting much more time in the pocket in leading Baltimore to a touchdown and a field goal on his first two series.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

div.p: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson provided electricity on his first drive of the night. His first pass was a 36-yard completion to Chris Moore and his last play was a nine-yard touchdown run. He reached the end zone with a stutter step to elude one Rams defender and then used a cutback to score.

ul.data-name: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson provided electricity on his first drive of the night. His first pass was a 36-yard completion to Chris Moore and his last play was a nine-yard touchdown run. He reached the end zone with a stutter step to elude one Rams defender and then used a cutback to score.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

div.p: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson is coming into the game for Baltimore's second series. The former Heisman Trophy winner had been taking second-team reps this week in practice. This is an early entrance for Jackson, who played in the second half in last week's Hall of Fame game.

ul.data-name: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson is coming into the game for Baltimore's second series. The former Heisman Trophy winner had been taking second-team reps this week in practice. This is an early entrance for Jackson, who played in the second half in last week's Hall of Fame game.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

div.p: Ravens quarterback Joe Flacco continued a strong summer by looking very sharp on his first drive of the preseason. He was 5-of-7 for 70 yards and hit Patrick Ricard for a 6-yard touchdown. Flacco got his new targets involved early. He hit Michael Crabtree for 30 yards, connected with John Brown for 17 yards and found Hayden Hurst for 12 yards.

ul.data-name: Ravens quarterback Joe Flacco continued a strong summer by looking very sharp on his first drive of the preseason. He was 5-of-7 for 70 yards and hit Patrick Ricard for a 6-yard touchdown. Flacco got his new targets involved early. He hit Michael Crabtree for 30 yards, connected with John Brown for 17 yards and found Hayden Hurst for 12 yards.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

h1.a: Roll The Dice: Players Not Being Drafted That You Should Consider And Texans/Titans Double Trouble

div.p: Matthew Berry, Field Yates and Stephania Bell provide three players each that are not currently being drafted that they are interested in (6:50) as well as preview the Texans (29:47) and Titans (48:09) in double trouble.

h1.a: NFL preseason Week 1: All the best from Thursday's slate of games

div.p: Week 1 of the preseason saw Andrew Luck's return, all of the rookies' debuts, and more. Here's a roundup of the best from Thursday night's games.

h1.a: No quit in Robert Griffin III: 'Haven't lost my passion for the game'

div.p: Robert Griffin III has performed admirably thus far in camp, but the Ravens haven't kept three QBs on their roster since 2009.
Robert Griffin III throws extra passes after practice with some help from his wife

ul.data-name: Robert Griffin III throws extra passes after practice with some help from his wife

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

div.p: Play of day at Ravens camp: Janarion Grant used a terrific jump cut to elude a handful of Rams on a punt return. Grant then held the ball out in his extended right hand to taunt, which led to him getting ripped by special teams coordinator Jerry Rosburg.

ul.data-name: Play of day at Ravens camp: Janarion Grant used a terrific jump cut to elude a handful of Rams on a punt return. Grant then held the ball out in his extended right hand to taunt, which led to him getting ripped by special teams coordinator Jerry Rosburg.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

div.p: Ravens tight end Darren Waller has been reinstated by NFL commissioner Roger Goodell after being suspended for all of last year for violating the league's substance abuse policy. Waller is on the field but isn't suited up for practice. To make room on the 90-man roster, Ravens waived injured wide receiver Jaelon Acklin.

ul.data-name: Ravens tight end Darren Waller has been reinstated by NFL commissioner Roger Goodell after being suspended for all of last year for violating the league's substance abuse policy. Waller is on the field but isn't suited up for practice. To make room on the 90-man roster, Ravens waived injured wide receiver Jaelon Acklin.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

div.p: As Rams cornerback Aqib Talib walks out to a joint practice with the Ravens, one player from Baltimore's Woodlawn High School asked him: "Where's the chain at?" This is in reference to Talib's run-ins with wide receiver Michael Crabtree.

ul.data-name: As Rams cornerback Aqib Talib walks out to a joint practice with the Ravens, one player from Baltimore's Woodlawn High School asked him: "Where's the chain at?" This is in reference to Talib's run-ins with wide receiver Michael Crabtree.

a.class: btn-social sm email icon-font-before icon-email-solid-before Shortstop

h1.a: Ravens' Weddle: RPOs a fad, won't last in NFL

div.p: The Ravens' Eric Weddle believes the run-pass option will be out of the NFL in five years and is "just another phase."
